column4: hi! can aybody tell my if it's better an Intel Pentium D 930 or a 830?The first one is a dual core with separate cores and 2x2mb of cache, the second one has the cores on the same silicius and 2mb shared.
they both suck heh
i did not say intel sucked. i said both of the processors mentioned sucked (and they do)
so wich is a processor that doesn't suck?
if you want a good dual core processor, then you want core duo or core 2 duo
Pentium D is dual core
i know this. the pentium D also sucks hard.
core duo is the product name.
core duo is only for Mac... the 64bit dual core of Intel is named Pentium D
no, it is NOT only for mac, and 64bitness is irrelevent
the pentium product line is dead (and good riddance)
so here in italy there's not this core duo. THey sell only pentium D. Why?
probably demand, the core duo isn't very popular yet
so i can choose from: Pentium D, Amd 64 and Amd64 X2. what should i choose? You must consider that AMD costs 20%more than Intel
probably the amd64 x2, unless money matters a lot
you can't use a pentium M (mobile, like centrino) in a desktop machine, i think
that was only what i thought, maybe not what's true
http://www.tomshardware.com/2006/04/24/dual_core_intel_processors_for_low/page3.html <--- here you can see that core duo's not available on desktop systems.
the core 2 duo will be though :)
and you can get a core duo desktop motherboard, or at least a pentium M one. i've seen em
tomshardware tell the contrary
http://www.hothardware.com/viewarticle.aspx?articleid=811&cid=3
and http://system76.com/product_info.php/cPath/2/products_id/155?osCsid=a96f542ad94b3ee6a5eb5add0b84d391
